intro: Psychotria levuensis, commonly known as the Kava kava plant, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its most notable feature is the presence of alkaloids in its roots, which have been traditionally used for their calming effects. Psychotria levuensis is also valued for its ecological role in tropical ecosystems.
